His daughter Ilham Yousef Al-Qaradawi is an internationally recognized nuclear scientist.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.world-nuclear-university.org/about.aspx?id=25736&terms=ilham |title=Advisory Committee to the WNU RI School Al-QARADAWI Ilham |publisher=World-nuclear-university.org |date= |accessdate=2010-04-11}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.qu.edu.qa/artssciences/mathphysta/documents/CVs/Ilham_AlQaradawi_2008.pdf |title=Curriculum Vitae Ilham AlQaradawi |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2010-04-11}}</ref>

His daughter [[Ilham Yousef Al-Qaradawi]] is an internationally recognized nuclear scientist.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.world-nuclear-university.org/about.aspx?id=25736&terms=ilham |title=Advisory Committee to the WNU RI School Al-QARADAWI Ilham |publisher=World-nuclear-university.org |date= |accessdate=2010-04-11}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.qu.edu.qa/artssciences/mathphysta/documents/CVs/Ilham_AlQaradawi_2008.pdf |title=Curriculum Vitae Ilham AlQaradawi |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2010-04-11}}</ref> While his son [[Abdurrahman Yusuf al-Qaradawi|Abdurrahman]] is a [[Poet]] and a political activist in [[Egypt]]<ref name="Abdurrahman Yusuf al-Qaradawi: new branches of National Association for Change Will open soon in Europe and the United States">[http://www.masrawy.com/News/Egypt/Politics/2010/april/17/baradei.aspx?ref=moreclip Abdurrahman Yusuf al-Qaradawi: new branches of National Association for Change Will open soon in Europe and the United States]</ref>.
